newsitem.title: USA: Bay Networks sees "substantial" Q2 charge.
newsitem.headline: Bay Networks sees "substantial" Q2 charge.

text.p: Bay Networks Inc. said Tuesday it completed the acquisition of Penril Datacomm Inc's modem business and expected to take a substantial second-quarter charge as a result.

Bay Networks, which bought the business for about $124 million, said it expected to take a charge equal to "a substantial portion of the purchase price" in the second quarter ending December 31 to account for acquisition-related costs and write-downs.

Under the terms of the deal, Bay Networks exchanged 0.448 of a share of each stock for each share of Penril Datacomm. Purchase of fractional shares will be based on $22.30 per full share. The transaction was treated as purchase for tax purposes.
Bay Networks, a provider of computer networking and related products, said it would issue about 5.37 million shares as part of the acquisition and assume some debt.
